newsitem.title: DUBAI: Iran says seized 155 tonnes of drugs in 10 months.
newsitem.headline: Iran says seized 155 tonnes of drugs in 10 months.

text.p: Iran said it has confiscated 155 tonnes of narcotics at its border points in the past 10 months which indicated an increase in production in Afghanistan.

The official Iranian news agency IRNA said on Wednesday night that a meeting on fighting drugs trade held in Tehran revealed that "some 155 tonnes of various kinds of narcotics were seized at Iranian border points during the past 10 months".

It said the meeting concluded that the amount of seized drugs "suggests an increase of narcotic products in Afghanistan with the active support of some foreign states for producing and smuggling narcotics into Iranian territory".

It said the meeting was chaired by President Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani who "underlined the need to eradicate the evil of narcotics from the society and called for serious steps against the drug traffickers".
Iran lies on a major transit route for drugs smuggled to Europe via Turkey from Afghanistan and Pakistan -- the so-called "Golden Crescent".
